revised_title: Robert Howson Pickard's Contributions to Chemistry and Education
tldr: The obituary of Robert Howson Pickard highlights his significant contributions to chemistry, particularly in the field of stereochemistry and optical rotatory power. Pickard developed a method for resolving racemic secondary alcohols into their optically pure isomerides, which was of practical convenience and widely used. He also made notable contributions to education administration, serving as Principal of Battersea Polytechnic and playing a key role in the development of the University of London's external degree programs.
